--- Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Mitchell Timin
> <zenguyuno@y...> wrote:
> > You may remember that a couple of months ago we
> were
> > discussing the RAM requirement and the number of
> > neurons required for the 4-card puzzle.  Mr. Emile
> > Richard has written an analysis of a procedural
> > programming approach to this problem.  It is in
> the
> > Blog section of the ANNEvolve website.
> > 
> 
> Can you remind me in comparison the number of "bits"
> stored
> in your best neural solution?  I also wonder if
> storage capacity
> increases much if neurons are allowed to be
> continuous.

My best solution had 34 neurons, therefore 34 bits.

A continuous output neuron would have a far higher bit
capacity, if it was properly matched to the problem. 
I have no idea how it would work for this particular
problem.  Hopefully, we will know some day! :)
